meanings.definition: A drinking toast in Irish Gaelic meaning "health"
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone raised their glasses and said 'slainte' before taking a sip.
meanings.sent2: In Ireland, it is customary to say 'slainte' when toasting to someone's health.
meanings.sent3: The bartender jokingly shouted 'slainte' as he handed out the drinks to the customers.
meanings.sent4: The sound of 'slainte' echoed through the pub, filling the air with good wishes.
meanings.sent5: The word 'slainte' carries the warmth of well-being and camaraderie.

meanings.definition: Used as a friendly expression of good wishes or cheers in Ireland.
meanings.sent1: Slainte! Have a great day ahead!
meanings.sent2: When someone sneezes, you can say 'slainte' to wish them well.
meanings.sent3: Slainte! May your troubles be less and your blessings be more.
meanings.sent4: As the fireworks lit up the sky, the crowd cheered 'slainte' in unison.
meanings.sent5: The word 'slainte' rings out with joy and positivity in every gathering.
